title: Magnetism - trajectory of electron in B field

content.description: An electron is moving to the right, as shown. The electron passes through a region containing a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and then exits the region. The gravitational force on the electron is negligible.
content.question: Which of the following diagrams shows a possible path of the electron?

choices.label: The figure shows a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and the path of an electron that moves toward, through, and then away from the magnetic field. The electron moves horizontally to the right toward the magnetic field and then moves downward and to the right in a straight line from the left edge of the magnetic field and all the way through and then out of the magnetic field.

The figure shows a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and the path of an electron that moves toward, through, and then away from the magnetic field. The electron moves horizontally to the right toward the magnetic field, then moves downward and to the right in a straight line from the left edge to the right edge of the magnetic field, and then moves more steeply downward and to the right in a straight line from the right edge into the space moving away from the magnetic field.

The figure shows a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and the path of an electron that moves toward, through, and then away from the magnetic field. The electron moves horizontally to the right toward the magnetic field, then moves downward and to the right in an arc from the left edge to the right edge of the magnetic field, and then moves downward and to the right in a straight line from the right edge into the space moving away from the magnetic field.

The figure shows a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and the path of an electron that moves toward, through, and then away from the magnetic field. The electron moves horizontally to the right toward the magnetic field, then moves downward and to the right in an arc from the left edge to the right edge of the magnetic field, and then continues downward and to the right in an arc from the right edge into the space moving away from the magnetic field.

content.answer: The figure shows a uniform magnetic field directed into the page and the path of an electron that moves toward, through, and then away from the magnetic field. The electron moves horizontally to the right toward the magnetic field, then moves downward and to the right in an arc from the left edge to the right edge of the magnetic field, and then moves downward and to the right in a straight line from the right edge into the space moving away from the magnetic field.
